body:
Well, I think it's a bit unreasonable to directly point to the guide for `ambari 2.7.9`. 
Do we need to create a guidance document for trunk branch as well?

> Well, I think it's a bit unreasonable to directly point to the guide for `ambari 2.7.9`. Do we need to create a guidance document for trunk branch as well?

We are planning the release of version 3.0, and we will also update the official website.
OK, by then, it would be best for us to update REDME as well. thanks

Thanks for your work and for providing a solid idea for developing ambari-web. However, IMO, what we need is a simple proxy server. For Vite, the ideal choice should be [node-http-proxy](https://github.com/http-party/node-http-proxy). But in your code, you've included the initialization of a Vite project, and some of the resources there won’t actually be used—like the CSS files.

This kind of separated development environment increases debugging costs, so it’s more suitable for early, non-optimized DEV. Later on, I’d recommend replacing Brunch with Vite. This way, we can make better use of Vite’s features.
@virajjasani  Could you help review this pr?

> +1

Hello [virajjasani](https://github.com/virajjasani), I sent Ambari Security an email about this vulnerability a long time ago(
Wed, Nov 30, 2022, 5:14 PM) and provided you with a fix code, but there was no effective response. I saw you posted a vulnerability announcement today, but there was no credit list and I was not included, which was not a good feeling.

In fact, there is another vulnerability that has been around for a long time and has not been dealt with. You can contact me at gtaritari720@gmail.com.

+ issue after email contact: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-26059
+ fix code https://github.com/tarihub/ambari/commit/978f2b7447591de74e2a8fabd4309adbc07135ad#diff-66115707a6b8ee4806fa047a45d27973ae9576bb50e55e2d302848955341336b

@tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it.

> @tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it.

Can you email me? I forwarded you the details of another vulnerability, which has not been fixed yet

> > @tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it.
> 
> Can you email me? I forwarded you the details of another vulnerability, which has not been fixed yet

 Ok, thank you for following Ambari and submitting Ambari-related CVEs

> > > @tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it. > > > > > > Can you email me? I forwarded you the details of another vulnerability, which has not been fixed yet > > Ok, thank you for following Ambari and submitting [Ambari-related](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-related) CVEs I don't have permission to open this link. It seems that our jira permissions can only access normal issues.
@tarihub  Could you create a PR for the trunk branch? We plan to release Ambari 3.0 based on the trunk next month. I can help review and merged it.

> > > > @tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it. > > > > > > > > > Can you email me? I forwarded you the details of another vulnerability, which has not been fixed yet > > > > > > Ok, thank you for following Ambari and submitting [Ambari-related](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-related) CVEs > > I don't have permission to open this link. It seems that our jira permissions can only access normal issues. > > Because the issue seems to have stopped being fully open to the public, I will follow up with the Apache security team about this. In the meantime, you can register first and then @virajjasani to ask for their help in approving your registration.

> @tarihub Could you create a PR for the trunk branch? We plan to release Ambari 3.0 based on the trunk next month. I can help review and merged it.

Another vulnerability was previously discussed via email for a fix, but no results were reached.

> > > > > @tarihub Sorry, this was a management and communication error between us and the security team regarding the user information for vulnerability submissions. Next time, you can email me directly and I'll handle it. > > > > > > > > > > > > Can you email me? I forwarded you the details of another vulnerability, which has not been fixed yet > > > > > > > > > Ok, thank you for following Ambari and submitting [Ambari-related](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-related) CVEs > > > > > > I don't have permission to open this link. It seems that our jira permissions can only access normal issues. > > > > Because the issue seems to have stopped being fully open to the public, I will follow up with the Apache security team about this. In the meantime, you can register first and then @virajjasani to ask for their help in approving your registration. I already have an account on jira, my username is tari, but I don't have permission to view security issues, so let me see how to submit it to you.
@virajjasani Could you help tarihub check his jira acoount?

I have provided contributor access to `tari` jira id. @tarihub you can create PR directly, or feel free to discuss over email thread including `private@ambari.apache.org`, `security@apache.org` and `jialiangcaimd@gmail.com`.
@JiaLiangC  can you please review and merge this PR. I have added JIRA ticket so now CI should pass.

We should avoid using the "Squash and Merge" option for this pull request. Additionally, the "Rebase and Merge" option is currently disabled. Therefore, I believe we will need to merge this PR using backend methods

@nikita15p  What is the purpose of your PR? The APIs of the trunk and the front branch are compatible, so there's no need to merge. I think a good approach would be to use the method described in https://dev.to/vinomanick/react-micro-frontend-in-ember-app-part-2-3hg8, which allows us to gradually migrate the Ember frontend to the React frontend.

> We should avoid using the "Squash and Merge" option for this pull request. Additionally, the "Rebase and Merge" option is currently disabled. Therefore, I believe we will need to merge this PR using backend methods



> We should avoid using the "Squash and Merge" option for this pull request. Additionally, the "Rebase and Merge" option is currently disabled. Therefore, I believe we will need to merge this PR using backend methods

I think we can adopt a micro-frontend approach for gradual migration, as a complete refactoring would likely take a considerable amount of time.

@JiaLiangC I have rebased the latest frontend-refactor because I am working on ambari-web switch functionality to support both ReactJS and emberJS . So before I send my first PR of basic layouting, I intended to have latest code of ambari and hence rebased. 
Also, I am trying to follow same approach as it was done earlier in  frontend-refactor branch for ambari-admin angular->React modernisation.
